results.title: Henry Bolte speech at opening of relocated Dandenong Stock Market (1958)
results.brief_description:
Silent film footage of the then Premier of Victoria, Henry Bolte, presenting his speech at the opening of the Dandenong Stock Market at its new location in Cheltenham Road (1958). Includes scenes of dignitaries and spectators, and a tour of the stockyards.
Athol Adams footage is courtesy of Jenny and Owen Peake.
THIS FILM IS SILENT

results.title: Mallacoota fishing trip
results.brief_description:
Mallacoota - There is boatloads of nostalgic charm in this short black and white 1950s film of men taking a fishing trip at Mallacoota. Photographer Athol Adams has captured a sense of fun in this footage, made more entertaining to modern eyes because of the formal clothes the fishermen are wearing. A wonderful glimpse of a different generation at play.
Athol Adams footage is courtesy of Jenny and Owen Peake.

results.title: Melbourne city parade
results.brief_description: Silent film of the Queen Mother arriving at the Melbourne Town Hall during a Moomba parade. Includes scenes of crowds lining Swanston Street; the Lord Mayor’s welcoming speech to the Queen Mother; and her departure in an open car as she waves to the crowd. Filmed by portrait photographer Athol Adams. Athol Adams footage is courtesy of Jenny and Owen Peake.

results.title: The Queen Mother at Essendon Airport
results.brief_description:
Silent footage of the arrival on 27 February 1958 of the Queen Mother at Essendon Airport to a welcoming crowd of waving spectators, military parades and marching bands, and government officials and dignitaries. Filmed by portrait photographer Athol Adams.
Athol Adams footage is courtesy of Jenny and Owen Peake.

results.title: This little pig went to market
results.brief_description: In 1912, Dandy Hams and Bacon commenced at premises located in Dandenong, Melbourne. This short film is a rare record of Dandenong’s first major industry and features reminiscences by Maurie Jarvis (filmmaker Sue Jarvis’s father) who worked at Dandy from the age of 15 until he retired, first as a truck driver and then as a Sales Manager. Now aged 86 Maurie remembers quite fondly of his time at the Dandy Bacon Factory and talks about its operations and processes to a background of rare archival images of the factory buildings, its machinery and its workers. Sadly none of these buildings now exist.

results.title: First job after leaving school (c.1916)
results.brief_description: Interviewee Nin Martin from Goldsborough (near Dunolly) talks about his first job as a young lad in 1916 working for a mining company and how he, along with other young boys, used only a hammer to crush open the stones of quartz mined by the older diggers, in order to find the layer of molybdenum which was needed to strengthen the steel in the making of munitions for the war.

results.title: Age of the mountain man
results.brief_description: Re-enacts the hardships of two trappers and their Indian scout during a few days in 1840. The mountain men trap beaver and trade pelts with friendly Indians. After contact with hostile Indians they reconsider their way of life. Gives the flavour of a transitional period in the westward expansion of the US.

results.title: Eucalyptus oil distillery [excerpt]
results.brief_description: At the end of the war in 1946, Horrie Vernon and his brother set up a eucalyptus oil distillery in the small town of St Arnaud in Victoria. In this excerpt (which is part of a longer sequence) Horrie, who is still working the distillery, talks about how the eucalyptus oil is produced: from the collecting of the leaves, to the boiling of the leaves, the collecting of the steam and allowing it to condense, and finally, to the skimming of the oil off the surface. This process which is still carried out in the same way today. is demonstrated in the film.

results.title: Age of the Buffalo
results.brief_description: Uses paintings of the mid 19th Century to depict the era of the North American Plains Indian and the vast herds of buffalo that once grazed on the prairie.

results.title: Red line
results.brief_description: Carlton - ‘Imagine if there was a red line behind you’. Short narrative work presenting personal story from Carlton and Parkville. This film is an excerpt from ‘Stories from the hidden city’, a project conceived and directed by Bagryana Popov, 2000-2002.
